entry.title: Intercompany cost allocation with intercompany billing (invoice)
entry.content:
Dear experts,
in SAP Public Cloud, we are investigating if there is a way to create an intercompany invoice "automatically" with the relevant amount of costs which has been distributed / allocated via an CO intercompany cost allocation. I would have expected that for these allocations it should be more or less the same process like for direct activity allocation (e. g. as described in scope item 4AN / 4AU).
Is anyone aware if this is working for intercompany allocations as well or is it necessary to create the invoice manually?

Thanks in advance and best regards,
Max

entry.title: The Return of SAP Community Voice!
entry.content:
Last seen in October of last year, SAP Community Voice was our online newsletter, replacing the email version that had gone out to subscribers for many years. Now after a long hiatus, we’re bringing the online edition back!

SAP Community Voice highlights popular posts, important community news, upcoming events, and more. If you’re interested in hot SAP Community content and announcements, look no further. You’ll find it all summarized here.

This edition covers items from the last four weeks or so, and future editions will aim to deliver even more timely information on a regular basis. Make sure to subscribe to the SAP Community Voice label so you don’t miss any issues of our online newsletter!

 

Featured Content

 

Heartiest Congratulations to Our Newest SAP Champions!

SAP Champions include some of the best and brightest SAP Community members, and this month, my colleague @KatherineKenneally welcomes eight new people to the program. To learn more about them (and about the program), check out her post and find out how you can connect with SAP Champions in your region!

Read the blog post

 

The Complete Guide to Calling Actions in UI5 with Custom Code

Prolific SAP Community contributor @Marian_Zeis has published a blog post that will help you trigger OData actions and functions from UI5 like a pro -- no matter whether you’re using SAP Fiori elements or going purely freestyle (v2 or v4). This guide walks through every official API, shows exactly when to pick each one, and more.

Read the blog post

 

SAP Datasphere and SAP Analytics Cloud Availability via SAP Business Data Cloud

In this post, SAP’s @Ammar_Naji points out that SAP Datasphere and SAP Analytics Cloud are core components of SAP Business Data Cloud -- and that they soon won’t be on the list of eligible services under certain subscriptions. He explains what customers can do to prepare for these changes.

Read the blog post

 

Tree View in the ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model

Implementing a tree view in the ABAP RESTful application programming model requires different entities, and author @Vivek_Sahu_21 covers how you can show structured, hierarchical data -- in a parent-child format -- that UI applications and analytics tools can consume easily, providing a smooth user experience.

Read the blog post

 

Community News

 

“Blog It Forward” Is Back and Better Than Ever!

Blog It Forward is one of the longest-running initiatives in our community, dating all the way back to 2012 with this post from my colleague @moshenaveh. SAP Champion @Sandra_Solis brought the series back earlier this year with this post, and since then, several other members have contributed their own posts. The series allows members to introduce themselves while nominating other peers to participate, bringing the community closer together. Check out the Blog It Forward label to find all of the latest posts in this series, subscribe to the label to get updates when new posts appear, and consider writing one of your own!

 

Differentiating DSA Violations from Common Moderation Issues

We have taken steps to make our moderation process friendlier while ensuring that SAP Community continues to comply with the Digital Services Act (DSA). In this recent post, we outline the steps that members now should take when reporting inappropriate content to our moderation team, differentiating between common issues (e.g., incorrect tags) and true DSA violations.

 

Basic Etiquette and Tips for Participating in SAP Community

We are expanding the knowledge base in the Welcome Corner with new resources meant to help members get the most out of their SAP Community experience. In the latest post, we cover the type of behavior we expect from members, offer advice for friendly member interactions, indicate when to notify moderators, and more. Whether you’re a long-time community member or just getting started, you’ll benefit from the guidance in this document.

 

Upcoming Events

 

Registration Is Live for SAP TechEd 2025

SAP TechEd is scheduled for November, and this year, we’re building a hybrid experience that brings together the best of both worlds -- a full in-person experience in Berlin and a customized virtual experience for audiences around the world. Learn more about this exciting event in this blog post from SAP's @cecihuergo and register today for SAP TechEd!

 

Find SAP CodeJam Events in Your Region

SAP CodeJam events bring together developers who want hands-on learning about SAP technology, solutions, and applications. In August, you can attend SAP CodeJam sessions in Lima (Peru), Mexico City, Bogota (Colombia), and Wroclaw (Poland). Visit the SAP CodeJam activity group to learn more about these events, and check out the full list of upcoming events.

entry.title: Re: Error while triggering notification using Situation H...
entry.content:
Hello Jahnavi4,
 
i recently ran into the same (mostly the same) issue while trying to implement Situation Handling for contract expiry notifications in our on-premise S/4HANA system. Although the Situation Type and logic were configured correctly, the system failed to trigger the notification and threw the following error in transaction SLG1:
"Destination and O'Auth Profile for SAP Cloud Service not maintained"
 
After some investigation, i discovered that this error is related to the absence of required SAP BTP cloud destinations, such as:
 
  • BWZ_Fiori_Notification
  • Z_BWZ_NOTIFICATION
 
These destinations are typically used to route notifications through the SAP Launchpad Service (on BTP). Since our landscape does not have BTP or a configured Cloud Connector, we needed an alternative to enable notifications purely within our on-premise setup.
Below is are my notes how i solved this problem:
 
1.) Set Notification Channel to Fiori Launchpad
     Transaction: SITN_SETTINGS --> Notification Channel option --> Set it to: Fiori Launchpad
   
2.) Verify Situation Type Configuration  Transaction: SITNADMIN --> Situation Type = Active --> set Trigger Conditions.
 
3.) Enable Notifications for the User in Fiori Launchpad
   Fiori Launchpad --> user settings --> Notification Settings --> Notifications = enabled
 
4.) Check Gateway and Notification Services
/IWNGW/BEP_NOTIF = LOCAL 
 
 
maybe my solution will help you
Greetings Dom

entry.title: Re: Is it possible to create standard 'tax ledger' in pub...
entry.content:
Hi,

Currently, it is not possible in S4H Cloud to create or re-use on of the other ledgers for tax valuation aka "Tax Ledger". Such approach demands a dedicated custom specific accounting principle which cannot be created. Therefore, such an approach is neither recommended nor supported in any way. 

Best regards,
 Mick

entry.title: Inside SAP Series Mid-Year Wrap-Up: Powered by Practice, Driven by Data
entry.content:
As we head into the summer break, it’s the perfect time to reflect on what we’ve explored so far in this year’s Inside SAP series. Designed to give an inside look into how SAP’s IT organization drives innovation from within, the series features experts from across CPIT sharing real-world insights into how we use our own technology to transform the enterprise.

We opened the 2025 season with a clear message: transformation starts at home. In the first session, Oliver Gutzeit took us behind the scenes of SAP’s digital landscape, demonstrating how we bring together AI, data, processes, and applications to create real business impact.

The following three sessions focused on one of the most powerful enablers of that transformation: data. We explored how SAP is shaping a modern data architecture strategy to fuel both AI innovation and smarter decision-making. From building semantically rich data products, to scaling data and machine learning capabilities, to enabling broader access through data democratization efforts, the series offered valuable insights into how data is evolving into a strategic asset throughout SAP.

The importance of easy to consume and available data, as well as the mind shift needed to achieve this, were part of the session delivered by Oliver Huth, Head of Platform – SAP Enterprise Analytics. He captured the idea with the following analogy and visual illustration:

“We only create a data product if there's a need—just like a coke drink in the supermarket: it has to be well-placed, accessible, easy to consume, and trustworthy. You should be able to pick it up, use it immediately, and even combine it with others—because the real value comes when data products are interoperable and share the same semantics.”

Each session highlighted how SAP IT is applying these technologies internally, turning strategy into practice and challenges into scalable solutions.

Looking ahead, the second half of the series will shift its focus to AI. Resuming with the series in September, we’ll dive into how SAP is accelerating insights and transforming analytics through AI-powered capabilities. You’ll hear how data and intelligence come together to deliver value across the business, and how we’re transforming user experiences with natural language and automation. The series will then explore further topics such as financial planning, process mining as well as SAP’s own sales transformation, all with the goal to share our insights and lessons learned and to inspire our customers on their journey to bring out their best.

Until then, you can catch up on past sessions and register for the upcoming ones on the event page.

Enjoy the summer and, we look forward to continuing the journey with you soon!

entry.title: Data Governance - Introduction of Data Governance (APJ)
entry.content:
Steps to establish robust data governance to maximize the value of data as a strategic asset, driving better decision-making and leveraging big data for organizational growth and success

 

Overview

Managing a data governance framework can feel like taming an unruly beast. Multiple data sources, siloed teams, and unclear governance lead to confusion and risks. Take back control with proven Data Governance Transformation Programs. Introducing 1:Few Sessions for SAP SuccessFactors customers.

In this interactive webinar,  Data Governance SAP expert and Transformation Advisor Nicole Wright will share real-world examples and leading practices, providing an opportunity for customers to collaborate, share insights, and learn from colleagues in other organizations.

Each month we will alternate with the two topics 

Introduction of Data Governance

Introduction to HR Data Catalog

 

Why should you attend?

 

In these interactive sessions, SAP SuccessFactors customers will network and gain insights to tame their data governance frameworks. Attendees will also have the opportunity to exchange ideas and experiences in an open peer-to-peer format, strengthening their ability to manage data as a strategic asset and ensure compliance, security, and accuracy across their HR tech ecosystems.

 

We will talk about:

Relevant programs to be successful at your transformation

•Data Management Strategy

•Data Governance

•Data Governance Charter

•Operating Framework and Responsibilities

•Plan for Operational Success and HR Data Catalogue

•HR Data Governance

•Data Governance Roadmap

•Data Governance and AI

entry.title: How to change posting rules for co-product settlement?
entry.content:
Is there any solution to change the posting rules from production order rather than the material master data in public cloud?

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to change posting rules for co-product settlement?
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

In the scenario of Joint Production with Co-Products, settlement rules apply on two levels:

  • On order header: The settlement receivers are order items. The rule determines how the total order costs are distributed over the main product and co-products, that is, over the individual order items.

  • On order items: The settlement receivers are the stocks of each co-product item.

For more information, see Joint Production and Event-Based Cost Distribution (Co- and By-Products).

Event-based posting rules can be displayed and edited in two ways:

  • Use Fiori app Display Posting Rules - Event-Based (F5228): From the order master data screen in the Change Production Order (CO02) or Change Process Order (COR2) app by choosing Header  Settlement Rule, you navigate to the posting rule detail page of the Display Posting Rules - Event-Based app and edit the rule.
     Remember
  • Use RAP business object I_EventBasedOrderPostingRuleTP (Event-Based Manufacturing Order Posting Rule).


For more information, please check Settlement Rules of Manufacturing Orders (Event-Based Posting Rules) and 3042673 - SAP S/4HANA Cloud: Event-Based Cost Distribution for Co-Products from Order Header to Order Item - SAP for Me 


Best Regards,
SAP Support

entry.title: Can ex-post forecast values for each historical period in the Test Phase be in a stored key figure?
entry.content:
I am providing consulting work for a client that uses SAP IBP.

The client wants to know if ex-post forecast values for each historical period in the Test Phase can be in a stored key figure. That way, they can see how each individual period in the error measure calculation horizon was forecasted to compare against actuals, which may help with forecast model selection and/or parameter tuning.

As we move forward we will have a better idea exactly how the migration cadence will proceed with regards to data center providers and regions, customer tenant types etc.

As soon as we can confidently provide information on the migration schedules we will do so, but it is too early to provide accurate information at the moment.

Additionally, it's possible to download connector templates to view sample import files in the correct format (Downloading Learning Connector Templates).

entry.title: Reimagining Talent: The Power of AI, Skills, and People Intelligence (APAC Time Zone)
entry.content:
The world of work is changing fast – and so are employee experiences. Join us for a webinar where we explore the latest trends shaping the future of talent and showcase new innovations designed to help you attract, grow, and retain your workforce.  

In this webinar, you will: 

  • Hear the latest research on people analytics and talent management
  • Leverage AI and skills-based tools to develop a workforce that’s ready for what’s next 
  • Utilize People Intelligence – our new analytics solution – to turn talent data into real-time insights
  • See real-world use cases and insights into skills, succession planning, and career development
  • Watch a live demo of the latest innovations across our Talent Management and People Intelligence solutions

Whether you’re focused on workforce planning, talent development, or driving business outcomes through people data, this session will show you what’s possible with SAP SuccessFactors.

entry.title: Re: SAP MDG: Custom Generic Class for developments
entry.content:
Sorry, I'm having trouble understanding anything from this...

The title says "custom generic class for developments". What "developments"? Why do you need a "generic" class? OK, maybe it's explained in the text.

The text: "several ways to implement it". What is this "it" you speak of? How is "it" related to MDG? 

Next it says "one of the Enhancement UIBB & a Method is GET_DATA" - maybe it makes some sense to the ABAPers who are intimately familiar with MDG but with my general MDG knowledge I struggle to understand what is UIBB and this method. Why did you chose this example and what does it do? 

My professors at the university drilled it into my mind that before any abbreviation is used, it should be explained. I bet many readers are not MDG experts and would appreciate more context.

Then it gets curioser and curioser. "Every time i used to call the below program for different placeholders & for different requirements." OK... Why? What were the requirements? Why did you call this program? I also don't understand what exactly are you referring to as "development placeholder". This isn't official or common ABAP terminology. And why would you need a "placeholder"?

Then "reduce this reusability" - usually we try to improve reusability, not reduce it. But calling the same report(?) is not really a "reusability". 

Consequently, since it's impossible to understand the context and what exactly is the problem, it's also impossible to understand what this code is for. 

Idk, maybe some MDG specialists would be like "right on, I totally get it, super useful", but please be aware that for poor regular ABAP developers like me this post makes no sense. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

entry.title: Re: [S/4HANA Public Cloud] CDS Extraction to SAP Datasphere
entry.content:
Hello @popflorin 

Yes, this is a common setup issue when integrating SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition with SAP Datasphere using CDS-based extraction. You’re on the right track, but the issue most likely stems from missing or incorrect Authorization Group ID configuration in the Communication Arrangement.

Follow below steps to fix it

  • Edit the arrangement and set Authorization Group = SAP_DPS_ALL
  • Ensure your CDS Views are released and extraction-enabled (check in View Browser)
  • The communication user needs the right role (e.g. SAP_BR_ADMINISTRATOR)
  • Even with one CBC, each system (DEV/TEST) needs its own correct communication setup

CDS Views Enabled for Data Extraction-SAP Help

Once these are in place, the CDS views should appear in Datasphere.

Best,

entry.title: Navigating the Final Mile: Best Practices for SAP S/4HANA Cutover Planning and Execution
entry.content:
In SAP S/4HANA transformation journeys, the cutover phase is often referred to as the “final mile”—and rightly so. It’s the moment where strategy meets reality, and every decision made in prior months is put to the test. A successful cutover isn’t a happy accident—it’s the culmination of precise planning, exhaustive testing, and agile execution.

As someone who has led multiple global SAP S/4HANA migrations across industries and geographies, I’ve seen firsthand the difference between a reactive go-live and a proactive business launch. Below, I share tested best practices for ensuring that your cutover journey ends not in chaos, but in confidence.

1. Cutover Is a Business Event—Not Just a Technical Milestone

A cutover is more than flipping a switch—it’s a coordinated orchestration of business, IT, infrastructure, and partners. Treat it like a product launch. Develop a comprehensive cutover playbook that defines:

  • Task sequences
  • Role responsibilities
  • Timelines and dependencies
  • Communication plans for every stakeholder group

 Pro Tip: Mock cutovers aren’t just practice—they’re strategic simulations. Conduct them with full commitment and seriousness.

2. Cutover Plan: Build. Test. Validate. Refine.

Your cutover plan should go through the same level of rigor as your migration design. It must account for:

  • Data load sequencing
  • Application-specific downtime requirements
  • Backup and recovery checkpoints
  • Contingency and rollback plans
  • Shift-based staffing and escalation models

Create shift-wise execution schedules and real-time tracking dashboards to monitor progress across multiple workstreams.

3. Governance and Communication

Success in cutover lies in the strength of your command structure. Establish a dedicated war room with clear escalation paths, decision-making roles, and aligned communication rhythms.

Build tools such as:

  • Color-coded dashboards (risk/status)
  • Shift handover packs
  • Scheduled broadcast updates to stakeholders 

Pro Tip: Communication should be treated as a formal workstream—complete with check-ins, KPIs, and ownership.

4. Post-Cutover Stabilization

The work doesn’t stop at go-live. Set up structured validation checkpoints immediately after cutover, such as:

  • Reconcile opening balances
  • Validate transactional flows
  • Monitor and resolve migration anomalies

Develop a Hypercare strategy that includes SLA targets, support rotation schedules, and a metrics-driven escalation plan.

5. Institutionalize Lessons Learned

Every cutover reveals insights—capture them. Some recurring pitfalls include:

  • Shrinking validation windows
  • Late-cycle scope creep
  • Overconfidence due to lack of dry runs

Document lessons learned after every cutover and feed them into future readiness planning.

Conclusion

SAP S/4HANA cutovers are high-stakes, high-complexity endeavors. But with a proven framework, stakeholder alignment, and disciplined governance, they can become signature moments of organizational excellence. Cutover doesn’t have to be chaotic. With the right approach, it becomes the launchpad for sustainable transformation.

entry.title: Re: Extending Compensation Planning Publish to Metadata Framework - A step towards Integrated Suite
entry.content:
Hello,

Trying to publish to EC as well as MDF. I am receiving an error when trying to load the modified XML in the instance. The error message is: The content of element type "comp-config" must match "(comp-include?,(comp-number-format|comp-number-format-ext)*,(comp-field-definition|comp-field-group)*,comp-pay-matrix?,comp-currency-conv-table?,comp-stock-value-table?,comp-stock-participation-guideline?,(comp-rule-ref|comp-rule)*,comp-budget-rule*,comp-salary-rule*,comp-force-comment-config*,comp-rating-source*,comp-p4p-common*,comp-rating-input?,comp-display?,comp-instruction*,comp-instruction-tab-name*,comp-calculation?,comp-budget-label*,comp-plan-creation?,comp-manager-hierarchy?,comp-job-selector?,comp-budget-grouping?,comp-budget-override?,(comp-ect-output-component|comp-ect-output-component-group)*,comp-mdf-output-component*,comp-ect-history-config*,comp-group?,comp-variable-pay?,comp-varpay-refs?,comp-custom-action*,executive-review-filters?,ec-publish-filter*,comp-statement-suppression?,profile-access-point?)".

May I suggest that the order in which elements should be placed is important? I followed what you mention: An MDF mapping block using <comp-mdf-output-component> is required to be added to the XML of the plan template and should be positioned after the Budget Override section <comp-budget-override> and then Employee Central publishing  mapping section <comp-ect-output>.

But when I reversed the elements (e.g. comp-ect-output THEN comp-mdf-output-component) I was able to upload without the error.

entry.title: Re: Condition Types in Purchase Orders and Contracts (Hea...
entry.content:
Hello @Shubham120798 

In SAP S/4HANA Public cloud (ULIC 2508), pricing condition types are predefined. Common valuation-relevant ones include PB00 (Price) and FRA1 (Freight) at item level. Header-level types like RA01/RA02 are informational and not valuation-relevant.

You can’t create custom condition types, but you can deactivate or exclude unwanted ones via SSCUIs like 101120 (Define Condition Types) and 101117 (Pricing Procedure).

Only item-level conditions post to accounting. Header-level conditions do not affect inventory valuation

Configuration of Pricing - Purchasing SAP Help

Pricing in SAP S/4HANA Cloud for Service -SAP Community

With kind regard

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Creation of New Role in Release Strategy in SAP Publi...
entry.content:
Hello @khan_786 

To create a new role for PO release workflow in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition:

  1. Go to Maintain Business Roles app
  2. Create a new role and assign relevant catalogues, example (SAP_MM_BC_PO_WFL_MAINT_PC)
  3. Assign the role to users in Maintain Business Users
  4. In the Manage Workflows for Purchase Orders app, set Assignment By = Role and select your new role

Make sure the role also includes workflow inbox access (SAP_CORE_BC_BAS_WF_INBOX_PC).

Check below SAP Helpful documentations and let me know If it helps

Maintain Business Roles and Business Users

Maintaining Business Roles in SAP S/4HANA, Public Cloud

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Watch the replays of our exclusive SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 Early Release Series!
entry.content:
SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition is part of SAP Business Suite that brings AI, data, and applications together into a fully integrated system. This community is open for anyone in the Cloud ERP ecosystem–customers, partners, and SAP experts.

The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Early Release Series is a biannual event showcasing live sessions led by product experts. These sessions provide an exclusive preview of upcoming innovations, including AI-driven features and advancements with Joule, tailored to selected lines of business and industries. Spanning several days, the series offers expert demos, insider previews, and real-time Q&A, giving participants a first look at exciting updates and the opportunity to get their questions answered directly.

From July 21 to July 25, 2025, we hosted 21 compelling live sessions to highlight the exciting innovations shipped with the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release. Missed the live sessions? We've got you covered! Take advantage of the entire series or pick and choose the sessions most relevant to you–on demand, anywhere, anytime.

 

Please note that the recordings and presentations are still being added to the SAP Learning Hub. If you encounter a "no classes available" note, check back in a couple of days.

 

Watch the recordings here:

_________________

Sign-up instructions:

An active SAP Learning Hub license is required to consume the recordings. Find out how to sign up

As a customer:

Access to at least the SAP Enterprise Support Edition is required. Follow these steps to sign up:

  1. Navigate to the sign-up page and click on the “sign up” button.
  2. Authenticate yourself with your S-user ID and password.
  3. The system will check your eligibility, create a new SAP Learning Hub user, and populate your learning catalogue.
    This process may take up to 2 hours
  4. You will receive a registration confirmation via e-mail once the registration process is complete.

As a partner:
Partners with a valid SAP Universal ID, who are able to login to the Empowering SAP partners site, will be able to access the recordings.

As an SAP internal:
Register here for the SAP Learning Hub Internal Edition (free of charge) by clicking on “access”.

Experiencing issues?
Make sure to be logged on before trying to access the recordings. In case of any other issues, reach out to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Early Release Series

entry.title: How to backup staged critical data in S/4HANA Cloud?
entry.content:
Dear SAP,

How to perform a staged backup of critical data within SAP, including foundational data, orders, invoices, and certificates?

Are there relevant applications or convenient methods to support data export from the backend or frontend?

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to backup staged critical data in S/4HANA Cloud?
entry.content:
Dear Customer:

 

The backup services for SAP S/4HANA Cloud utilize various backup methods including regular data and archive log backups.

The SAP HANA database is backed up as part of the below backup strategy.  

                                                             

• Productive system: Daily data backup; archive logs multiple times daily.

• Nonproductive system: Weekly data backup; archive logs multiple times daily.

 

Please find the below document for more Infromation:

https://support.sap.com/content/dam/SAAP/S4H_910%20Backup%20and%20Disaster%20Recovery%20for%20S4HANA%20Cloud.pdf

 

Note: As S/4HANA public cloud is a SAAS product, backup management is fully handled by the SAP. The backups are taken as per the strategy which we have mentioned earlier in ticket, and we don't share the proof explicitly.  you can access the SAP Trust Centre for detailed information on compliance and security practices.

Link:  https://www.sap.com/about/trust-center.html

 

For a workaround, you can try with app "Customer Data Return"

Customer Data Return was primarily designed to fulfil a legal and contractual obligation from SAP to return customer owned data to customer primarily at the time of offboarding. Hence, the app was only built with the original use case in mind and doesn't provide any kind of backup functionality. We also don't have any other feature in S/4HANA Cloud that provides this kind of data.

What might be useful for you is the other features provided by the Customer Data Return.

With Customer Data Return, you use two SAP Fiori apps to extract and download customer data respectively:

Customer Data Return – Extraction app: To extract business data or archiving data owned by customers from the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition system to a temporary storage area.

Customer Data Return – Provisioning app: To download business data or archiving data owned by customers from the temporary storage area to your system.

Key Features: 

  • Extraction and download of all or a specific set of business data or archiving data owned by the customers
  • Data download in a compressed format, such as *.ZIP files
  • Configurable size and format (.XML or .CSV) for the download files
  • Display of status, progress, and logs for the extraction and download processes

App Execution:

To execute Customer Data Return, you need to:
  1. Trigger file preparation: This is carried out by the extraction user.

    For more information, see Working with the Customer Data Return - Extraction App.

  2. Trigger file download: This is carried out by the provisioning user.

    For more information, see Working with the Customer Data Return - Provisioning App.

 

Thanks and Best Regards,

Bell

entry.title: Revenue Recognition Revaluation Based on Periodic Exchange Rates for Foreign Currency Contracts
entry.content:
When a contract item is maintained with a list price in a foreign currency, each revenue recognition run revalues the revenue to be realized based on the total contract item net value in company currency as of the posting date of the run. The system calculates realized revenue as the delta between the revenue to be realized in the current period and the revenue already realized in previous periods.

As a result, the realized revenue per period in company currency may not directly match the transaction currency amount per period multiplied by the applicable exchange rate. This can lead to confusion when validating recognized revenue across periods using transaction currency values.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Revenue Recognition Revaluation Based on Periodic Exc...
entry.content:
This is the standard system behavior.

Once the contract item is completed—i.e., the end date is reached, and the invoicing and fulfillment statuses are marked as Finished—any deferrals or accruals posted due to exchange rate differences will be cleared in the subsequent revenue recognition run.

To better control and align the exchange rate used during revenue recognition, you can use the PDI Enhancement option:
SalesAccrualsSalesDocumentCurrencyCurrencyConversion.

By utilizing the CurrencyConversionDate field, you can explicitly provide the exchange rate date to be considered.

Additionally, in Business Configuration → Currency Conversion Profiles, for Business Transaction Type: Revenue Recognition, change the Conversion Date setting from:

'1 - Document Date' → to → '3 - Conversion Date'

This configuration allows the system to consider the date provided in the CurrencyConversionDate field during currency translation. As per system logic:

“If CurrencyConversionDate is not initial, the currency translation will use this date as the currency conversion date. Otherwise, the posting date is used. Note that whether this date is considered in revenue recognition depends on the currency conversion profile.”

Note: If '3 - Conversion Date' is set but no date is provided in the CurrencyConversionDate field, the system will default to using today’s date.

This approach is recommended to avoid over- or understating revenue due to exchange rate fluctuations during the revenue recognition process.

entry.title: Accessing Remote SAP HANA Cloud Data from S/4HANA Public Cloud using CDS External Entity
entry.content:
Prerequisites

Before starting, make sure you have:

  • SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud system with developer access

  • SAP HANA Cloud instance on BTP with:

    • SQL Endpoint enabled

    • Allow All Access or trusted IP configuration

  • Technical user in HANA Cloud with necessary privileges (e.g., CREATE REMOTE SOURCE, schema access)

  • ABAP Development Tools (ADT) in Eclipse

High-Level Concept And Reference

Blog reference : ABAP CDS Release News 2408 – External Entities - SAP Community
Help portal reference: External Entities | SAP Help Portal

 the workflow and artifacts for establishing an outbound SQL access with CDS external entities:

  • CDS External Entity: Design-time ABAP artifact mapping to an external database object

    • The following types of external entities are available:
      • Dynamic external entities: The logical external schema is bound to the external entity at runtime, when the entity is accessed with ABAP SQL SELECT, using a PROVIDED BY clause. Dynamic external entities can be accessed by ABAP SQL only. They cannot be used as a data source for other CDS entities.
      • Static external entities: The logical external schema is specified in the data definition of the external entity. Static external entities can be used as a data source in ABAP SQL, as a data source in other CDS entities, and in ABAP Managed Database Procedures (AMDP).
      • Writable external entities: By default, external entities are read-only. An external entity can be defined as writable using the optional addition writable. Writable external entities allow modifying data on external database systems using the ABAP SQL operations INSERT, UPDATE, MODIFY, and DELETE. 

  • Logical External Schema: Links external entity to outbound communication

  • Communication Arrangement: Defines connection to HANA Cloud via Outbound SQL Access

Implementation Steps

For Developer in  ABAP environment

  • Create CDS External Entity
    • In this scenario ,we use Writable external entity 
    • Core Data Services-Data Definition
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'External Entity'
define writable external entity (ENTITY NAME) external name (HANA DATABASE TABLE NAME)
{
  key ID       : abap.char(36) external name ID;
      TEST     : abap.int1     external name TEST;

}
with federated data provided at runtime
​
  • Create Logical External Schema
    • Core Data Services - Logical External Schemas
  • Create Communication scenario with outbound service
    •  Cloud Communication Management-Communication Scenarios-outbound service
       Create Outbound Service Referring to  a Logical External Schemas   
  •  Add outbound service to Communication scenario  
    •  Cloud Communication Management-Communication Scenarios
  • ABAP SQL statement
    • (SQL test should be used after communication configuration in SAP Fiori application)
   SELECT * FROM （cds external entity)
      PROVIDED BY (logical external schema)
      INTO TABLE @FINAL(lt_federated_data)
      UP TO 10 ROWS.

For SAP Fiori Application

  • Create Communication System

    • Host: SQL Endpoint of HANA Cloud

    • Port: 443

    • Authentication: Technical User (HANA DB user)

  • Create Communication Arrangement

    • Outbound Service: Outbound SQL Access

    • Adapter: HANA (ODBC)

    • Adapter Configuration: this parameter is important ,or  you will get ping fail message.

ServerNode=<hana_sql_endpoint>:port
  • Assign Outbound User (same as HANA DB user)
  • Check Outbound Service Connection  
    • success message:

 

  • Test SQL in ABAP Environment (see for developer part)

Using CDS External Entities with Outbound SQL Access provides a clean and ABAP-native way to query external SAP HANA Cloud data from S/4HANA Public Cloud.

entry.title: Re: Business Partner Role for Manufacturer
entry.content: Remove

entry.title: Re: Business Partner Role for Manufacturer
entry.content: Remove tag

entry.title: Re: Business Partner Role for Manufacturer
entry.content: Remove tag SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Sourcing and Procurement and add tag SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Master Data.

entry.title: Re: MIGO - Runtime Errors - MESSAGE_TYPE_X
entry.content:
I have given the solution.

In ECC system Path

SPRO -> Sales and Distribution -> Foreign Trade/Customs -> SAP Global Trade Services - Plug-In -> Control Data for Transfer to SAP Global Trade Services -> Configure Control Settings for Document Transfer


1.For the relevant Application Level (MM0A, MM0B, MM0C, SD0A, SD0B and SD0C)
2.Select the application level -> double click on "Document types" in the Dialog Structure (left)
3.Document Types for the selected application level which are customised for GTS will be dispayed, 3.
For Each Document type please ensure that have NO flag set in any of the columns: "Compliance", "Customs","Risk", "VD / SD Worklist" and "GTS Dialog"
4.Delete all flags in these columns for the relevant Document types

In SAP S/4 HANA Path

S/4HANA path: SPRO -> Integration with Other SAP Components ->Integration with Governance, Risk andCompliance ->SAP Global Trade Services -> Control Data for Transfer to SAP Global Trade Services -> ConfigureControl Settings for Document Transfer.

 

Note:- Please refer to SAP Note Number-20250729

entry.title: Re: Duplicate item position when performing GR from PO
entry.content:
If the PO item has had previous GRs, entering a delivery note might trigger the system to show each GR-relevant entry separately. Especially in GR-based invoice verification, SAP may propose one line per delivery note or GR document.
If the delivery note number is reused or linked to multiple material documents, the system might interpret it as multiple deliveries for the same PO item.

What you can do is check the PO history to see if multiple GRs exist. Use Material Document Overview to verify if the delivery note is linked to more than one document. Test the same PO in MIGO and compare the behavior. Review any custom logic in the Custom Logic app for the business context MATERIALDOCUMENTITEM.

entry.title: Need Solution to Post SAC Plan Data (Cost Element 43) to SAP ECC along with sender & Receiver CC's
entry.content:
Hi Experts,
Question: 1
I would like to perform planned activity quantity allocations in SAP ECC, specifying the sender cost center, receiver cost center, and activity type, similar to how we handle actual postings using T-code KB21N.

Could you please advise if there is a corresponding T-code, function module, or BAPI available for handling this in the plan version?

Question: 2

In SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) Planning, we are planning data for Cost Element Category "43" with a Sender Cost Center and a Receiver Cost Center. This also Plan version

Now, we would like to write back this data to SAP ECC.

Could you please let us know if there is any function module, BAPI, or standard program available to post Cost Element Category "43" entries, including both Sender and Receiver Cost Centers?

Sample Data

Sender CCReceiver CCCost Element ("43")PeriodAmount
S1R18430002025011000

entry.title: Re: Cannot filter Cost Center list by Cost Center Groups...
entry.content:
Hi,

The selection screen currently shown in your screenshot is the current standard system design. Users have no available functions to adjust the display of this screen.
Your requirement belongs to a new feature request. Please raise a feature request about this topic according to KBA 2963059 New Feature Request in SAP S/4HANA Cloud.

KBA 2963059 - How to Submit Feature Requests for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Product

KBA 2807810 - What is Support issue – What is Feature Request: Cloud Solutions

KBA 0003606803 - How to submit product relevant feedback for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

 

Thanks and Best Regards.

entry.title: Re: Cannot Perform MIGO After Changing and Restoring PO R...
entry.content:
You can assess by running a report like ME2N or ME2K) to identify Open POs, Partially processed POs (e.g., no GR or partial GR), POs with service items (which use ML81N instead of MIGO)
Instead of deleting old strategies (e.g., A2, A3), deactivate them by removing classification values so they no longer trigger, Retaining the strategy key to avoid breaking existing POs. Deleting a strategy that’s already assigned to a PO can cause inconsistencies—even if you restore it later.
For material POs, try to complete GRs via MIGO before changing the strategy. For service POs use ML81N to accept services and post GR. This ensures the PO lifecycle is closed before the strategy logic changes.
Finally, keep both old and new strategies active temporarily. Allow time for open POs to be processed under their original strategy. Gradually phase out old strategies by adjusting classification values

entry.title: Re: Version Control Made Simple with Application Frontend Service
entry.content:
Hi Community,

"

Every version:

  • Has its dedicated version-specific URL
  • Can reference different services and codebases
  • Can be tested or validated in parallel with the current live version

Each application has exactly one active version at any given time. The active version is served from the application’s main URL. All other versions are accessible only via their version-specific URLs.
The active version is the version that is available to the end users."

 

Thanks for your selfless sharing, it really help us a lot.

 

🙂

Regards,

ZFiori.

entry.title: We aim to establish a direct mapping of GL accounts from ECC to BPC (Consolidations)..
entry.content:
Dear All,


We aim to establish a direct mapping of GL accounts from ECC to BPC (Consolidations). Could you please specify which fields within the GL master record indicate that an account is configured to flow into BPC? Our objective is to identify the relevant account attributes in the ECC GL master that determine whether an account should be included in BPC.
SAP has recommended the standard approach of first extracting data from ECC to BW using standard tools, and then transferring it from BW to BPC. We are currently following a similar process and also utilizing Anaplan to transform the data before it reaches BPC.
However, our business is now requesting alternative solutions that would allow for direct mapping from ECC to BPC.
I have proposed options such as using the Alternative Account Number, Group Account Number, and creating custom tables. Nevertheless, they are still interested in exploring whether any other alternative approaches are available.

Guna

entry.title: Re: Unable to convert planned order to purchase requisition
entry.content: You can execute MDUM which schedules MD15 in the background to convert planned orders into purchase requisitions. You can set up a variant to select planned orders within the opening period. This is the recommended workaround if users don’t want to manually convert via MD04 or MD15.

entry.title: Re: Sap business One mobile App Attachments
entry.content:
Hi FilippoMoioli 

For the mobile app:

Only the attachment folder defined in General Settings can be seen in the mobile app. User attachment folder defined under Administration > Setup > General > User Defaults is not supported.

Also check attached SAP note  1741618 for the issue faced.

Kind Regards
Nidhi
SAP Support

entry.title: Re: Move some quantity in MB52 at Transfer/Transit column
entry.content:
Go to MB51 to trace the material documents for the affected material and plant. Filter by movement types by 303, 305, 313, 315 (and their reversals: 304, 306, 314, 316). Look for entries where the removal (e.g. 303) was posted but the receipt (e.g. 305) is missing.

If the transfer was valid but incomplete go to MIGO or VL32N (for inbound delivery). Post the Goods Receipt using the correct movement type (e.g. 305 or 315). This will move the stock from "Transfer/Transit" to unrestricted or designated stock.

If the transfer was erroneous or no longer needed go to MBST or MIGO to reverse the original movement (e.g. 303 → 304). This will cancel the transit quantity and return it to the original stock.
